data.name: Connect_Goodbye
data.value: Come again anytime!

data.name: Connect_Info_Ask
data.value: So, what do you want to know?

data.name: Connect_Info_File_Rescue_001
data.value: Even if you can't connect to your partner, you can still do rescues with File Rescue.

data.name: Connect_Info_File_Rescue_002
data.value: When someone wipes out in a dungeon, a .sosmail file will appear in RESCUE/OUTBOX/SOS.

data.name: Connect_Info_File_Rescue_003
data.value: Have them send it to you, and place it in RESCUE/INBOX/SOS.

data.name: Connect_Info_File_Rescue_004
data.value: From there, you'll be able to do the rescue like you would normally.

data.name: Connect_Info_File_Rescue_005
data.value: After you've completed the mission, a .aokmail file will appear in RESCUE/OUTBOX/AOK.

data.name: Connect_Info_File_Rescue_006
data.value: Send it back to your partner, and have them place it in RESCUE/OUTBOX/AOK.

data.name: Connect_Info_File_Rescue_007
data.value: From there, they'll be able to continue their adventure!

data.name: Connect_Info_File_Rescue_008
data.value: However, keep in mind that you cannot receive rewards with this method.

data.name: Connect_Info_Friends_001
data.value: To connect with friends, first choose a server to communicate on.

data.name: Connect_Info_Friends_002
data.value: Then, exchange Team IDs with your friend to add them to your contact list.

data.name: Connect_Info_Friends_003
data.value: Once added, you can choose to rescue or trade with them.

data.name: Connect_Info_Friends_004
data.value: Just make sure you and your partner are connecting to the same server!

data.name: Connect_Info_P2P_001
data.value: Normally, communicating with a friend requires both players to connect to the same server.

data.name: Connect_Info_P2P_002
data.value: If you can't find a server that is online, you can't connect to your friend.

data.name: Connect_Info_P2P_003
data.value: But by connecting peer-to-peer, you won't need a server!

data.name: Connect_Info_P2P_004
data.value: First, you must exchange IP addresses with your partner. Be sure to give your IP only to trusted people.

data.name: Connect_Info_P2P_005
data.value: Then, configure your server settings use your friend's IP.

data.name: Connect_Info_P2P_006
data.value: You and your partner must also specify the same port. If left blank, the port defaults to 1705.

data.name: Connect_Info_P2P_007
data.value: Most importantly, you must forward the port to connect properly.

data.name: Connect_Info_P2P_008
data.value: Once you've set everything up, you can connect to your partner like normal.

data.name: Connect_Info_P2P_009
data.value: Be sure to set your server settings back to normal after you're done.

data.name: Connect_Info_Rescue_001
data.value: Friend Rescues are rescue missions between friends over the Internet.

data.name: Connect_Info_Rescue_002
data.value: If your friend wiped out in a dungeon, you could play the hero and come to their rescue!

data.name: Connect_Info_Rescue_003
data.value: Connect to a friend who was KO'd in a dungeon, and you will receive an SOS Mail.

data.name: Connect_Info_Rescue_004
data.value: When you get that mail, you can start a rescue mission at the counter to your right.

data.name: Connect_Info_Rescue_005
data.value: If you complete the mission, connect to your friend again to send them an A-OK Mail.

data.name: Connect_Info_Rescue_006
data.value: Once they get that mail, they can continue from where they fainted in that dungeon.

data.name: Connect_Info_Rescue_007
data.value: Just remember, you can only rescue friends if they're in dungeons you can access.

data.name: Connect_Info_Server_Host_001
data.value: Your game should come with a copy of PMDOServer.

data.name: Connect_Info_Server_Host_002
data.value: Run the program to host a server. It will remain up until you stop it.

data.name: Connect_Info_Server_Host_003
data.value: Be sure to port-forward to let other players connect properly.

data.name: Connect_Info_Trade_Item_001
data.value: You can exchange Pokémon-specific items with your friend over the Internet.

data.name: Connect_Info_Trade_Item_002
data.value: Items are traded from storage, and up to 8 can be sent at a time.

data.name: Connect_Info_Trade_Mail_001
data.value: You can trade any mission you're currently holding with your friend over the Internet.

data.name: Connect_Info_Trade_Mail_002
data.value: Be aware that when the mission is no longer in your hands, you will lose track of the Pokémon requesting it.

data.name: Connect_Info_Trade_Team_001
data.value: You can exchange assembly members with your friend over the Internet.

data.name: Connect_Info_Trade_Team_002
data.value: Send them abroad to your friend's team, and they'll send one of their members in return.

data.name: Connect_Info_Trade_Team_003
data.value: When sent in, they'll be treated like any other Pokémon that joined your team.

data.name: Connect_Info_Trade_Team_004
data.value: Just remember, Pokémon important to the team can't be sent over.

data.name: Connect_Intro
data.value: Hello there, this is the Connectivity counter.[pause=0] What can I help you with today?

data.name: Connect_Intro_Return
data.value: Need help with anything else?

data.name: Connect_No_Server
data.value: You haven't set a server yet![pause=0] Configure your server settings first.

data.name: Connect_Option_Advanced
data.value: Advanced Topics

data.name: Connect_Option_Connect
data.value: Connect to a Friend

data.name: Connect_Option_File_Rescue
data.value: File Rescue

data.name: Connect_Option_Friend_Rescue
data.value: Friend Rescue

data.name: Connect_Option_Friends
data.value: Connecting to Friends

data.name: Connect_Option_Host
data.value: Hosting a Server

data.name: Connect_Option_P2P
data.value: Connecting Peer-to-Peer

data.name: Connect_Option_Server
data.value: Configure Server

data.name: Connect_Option_Teammate
data.value: Teammate Exchange

data.name: Connect_Option_Treasure
data.value: Treasure Exchange

data.name: Records_Intro
data.value: Hello, this is the Rescue counter.

data.name: Rescue_AOK_None
data.value: You don't have any AOK mail right now.

data.name: Rescue_Begin
data.value: Very good! I'll show you to the rescue site right away!

data.name: Rescue_Confirm
data.value: Do you want to head out for a rescue in {0}?

data.name: Rescue_Goodbye
data.value: Please come see me anytime.

data.name: Rescue_Intro
data.value: Hello, I handle mail![pause=0] How may I serve you?

data.name: Rescue_Intro_Return
data.value: May I help you with anything else?

data.name: Rescue_Option_AOK
data.value: A-OK Mail

data.name: Rescue_Option_SOS
data.value: SOS Mail

data.name: Rescue_Return_Fail_001
data.value: Welcome back![pause=0] Oh, your rescue attempt went badly...

data.name: Rescue_Return_Fail_002
data.value: But there's no need to give up![pause=0] You can always try again!

data.name: Rescue_Return_Miss_001
data.value: Hm?[pause=0] You exited the dungeon without reaching the rescue point?

data.name: Rescue_Return_Miss_002
data.value: I'm afraid that won't do![pause=0] You'll have to try again.

data.name: Rescue_Return_Miss_003
data.value: Always remember, the mission isn't completed until you reach the rescue goal.

data.name: Rescue_Return_Success_001
data.value: Welcome back![pause=0] Your rescue mission...[pause=0] was a great success, of course!

data.name: Rescue_Return_Success_002
data.value: Do you have a message you want to send your friend?

data.name: Rescue_Return_Success_003
data.value: Very well![pause=0] Don't forget to send the A-OK Mail to the friend you rescued!

data.name: Rescue_Return_Success_004
data.value: I hope you will continue rescuing friends in trouble!

data.name: Rescue_SOS_None
data.value: You don't have any SOS mail right now.
